title_en: Riter India workers strike for the third time
summary_en:
Members of the Rieter Federation of Indian Workers have been on strike for almost sixty days.
The union has repeatedly expressed concern about the unfair labor practices of the company.
In January 2023, the union went on strike after the management refused to take into account the concerns of the union.
A complaint was filed with the Labor Department about the illegal employment of contract workers.
The management threatened union officials with suspension, transfers and dismissal.
RIEF called off the strike after 57 days, when the labor commissioner advised management to recall 24 employees.
The situation did not improve, and the workers were forced to go on strike again.
The management of Rieter India has filed lawsuits against union members in a civil court.
The management is currently offering voluntary retirement schemes to union members.

title_en: The brotherhood will slow down train traffic this Thursday to demand a pay rise
summary_en:
The Brotherhood trade union announced a reduction in train speeds to 30 km/h within 24 hours due to the lack of a wage increase.
The initial coercive measure was extended due to the inability to reach a wage agreement.
The guild claims that during the reign of Javier Miley, the railway budget was reduced by 59% and there are problems with obtaining basic resources.
The Brotherhood's forceful measure will be the second this year, as on February 21, activities aimed at raising wages were completely suspended.
The investigation after the accident at the height of Dorrego Street revealed a malfunction of the rolling stock, a lack of basic safety measures and a lack of proper maintenance of the trains.
The government has organized voluntary layoffs to reduce the shortage of railways.
